intro: Combretum aculeatum f. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flame tree, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bright red or orange flowers that are highly attractive to birds and insects. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for cultivation in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flowering display and drought tolerance.
